definition: (of the people in a group) to get into position (idiom)/(athletics) On your mark!
each/every

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
each/every
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: To put every atom in its place—the vision articulated by some nanotechnologists—would require magic fingers.
sentences.chinese: 要讓每個原子各就各位，需要魔術手指才辦得到。

sentences.english: We should have the dredge, barges and draglines in place about the same time.
sentences.chinese: 差不多要在同時使挖泥機，駁船和索鬥鏟各就各位。

sentences.english: Now, everybody takes his place. The show will begin in a minute.
sentences.chinese: 好了，大家各就各位，演出馬上就要開始了。

sentences.english: He gave his orders quickly, and in a couple of minutes every animal was at his post.
sentences.chinese: 他指揮果斷，幾分鐘後，所有的動物已經各就各位。

to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
one after the other/in single file
to issue an order
to be all present
settled/accomplished/ready
to walk in in a line
to file out/to walk out in a line
to be on call/to be on standby
to sit properly/to sit up straight
regular and thorough (idiom); methodically arranged
to be ready/to be in order
to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
on call/always available/ready at all times
